Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: lakumm
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting luxury, this is not the place for you. However, if you are on the lake boating and want a clean place to stay, this is the best bet for your money. We go to Table Rock at least once a year and have tried out many other resorts. Green Valley is the place where we keep coming back. It is clean, cool, comfortable and convenient. Last time we rented the 2 bedroom, 2 bath "cabin" and comfortably slept 6 adults.

Reviews.Title: “A place on the lake to rest”
Reviews.Author: gtate20000
Reviews.Content: Statayed here overnight with the family in what is called a "cabin". This term should be used very lightly as the "cabin" is a two three room concrete block house. That said it has a good air condintioner with a full, yet tiny, modern kitchen. The TV is a small flat screen however it only received one channel....CMT. In the end we will likely return as a camping destination.

Reviews.Title: “HOW COULD YOU ASK FOR MORE”
Reviews.Author: tholzheimer
Reviews.Content: I have been on this resort for 4 days an will be staying another 6 days I am already planning my next trip.The owner her takes great pride in the comfort of her guest Something you dont see anymore we are here as a family an we have stayed in 3 units #1,11,an 14 all are clean an have the feeling of home attatched to them my husband an i arrived with our daughter an her boyfriend on Thursday with the rest of our family arriving on Sat my mother in law is in a wheel chair an the owner made a special effert to make sure all was set up for her arrival The grounds have all you could ask for hot tub ,pool,playground,basketball,volleyball, lots of lake front area which include boat docks an swim deck rental pontoons an paddle boat ..Beautiful veiws This is an older resort but for the money is worth every dollar. Grocery an Walmart is 7 miles away an 18 miles to Branson THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE GREAT TIME

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to a peacefull stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful lady named Chi e ko on the phone and then so in person. She was very honest on the phone and gave any details we asked for about the resort. I felt like I knew her before we even arrived at the resort.My best friend(Debbie) and her husband wanted to stay at same resort and close to our cabin,and she made it happen for all of us, we stayed for 6 nights and were happy with everything at the resort.The cabins were well equipted and CLEAN,it was a 15 minute drive to stores for supplies, and 30 minutes to Branson strip.If you love quite,peacefull,well kept lawns,beautifull flowers,decorative pond with koi fish and relaxing sounds this is a great find, off the hustle of heavy traffic and right to shore access this is a great find.This is very kid friendly,lots of things to do,and hot tub,pool,and very helpfull staff. We will go back again,hope this is a great summer for Green Valley Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “So much potential, but needs TLC”
Reviews.Author: Barbiu
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family get-together at GVR and after reading a few of the other reviews, I felt compelled to add my my review. I made our original reservation online and prior to arriving had a phone call from the owner saying she would need to move us to Unit #19. I had no objection and upon arriving was okay with the modular-type 2 bedroom unit. My main concern was that it was clean, and it was. Chieko, the owner was also very accommodating when we asked if there was another unit available for another member of our family who originally planned to stay with us, but everyone was more comfortable with them having their own 2 bedroom unit. The daily rates were very reasonable and the location would be hard to beat. The boat dock was a fun place to swim with noodles. We rented a pontoon from GVR (with yellow cover) and had a great day on the lake. Nice system for getting clean towels, trash bags, & toilet paper. The grounds definitely could use some TLC, but we came for the lake and that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey cabin, litter on grounds”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSpringfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in July. It was okay (only because we didn't pay too much), but disappointing based on what I saw on the website. Good: The pool and swimming dock were nice. There was a nice play area for kids. Lots of picnic tables and grills. You could exchange towels or get new supplies pretty much anytime. Bad: There was litter scattered around on the ground and around the pool. Our cabin smelled like an ashtray. The cabin (supposedly on the lake) was made of cinderblocks and was VERY basic and was NOT on the late. If it had a fitness center and kids activities, I didn't know about them.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort for an Incredible Price”
Reviews.Author: lakefamily2011
Reviews.Content: My family and I had never been to Branson. We were coming down from Kansas City to get a puppy. The family that we got the dog from recommended Green Valley Resort. When I checked it out online, I was really surprised at the rates so we booked a 3 night stay in cabin #20. I had no idea what to expect and we were so surprised and happy to see our accomodations when we got there. It was so beautiful. Our cabin had a beautiful view of the lake from our screened-in porch. The lake was only about 30 yds from our door. Our kids had a great time looking on the shore for shells and floating on rafts. It was like our own private beach. The cottage was completely furnished with a super comfy king sized bed along with 2 queen size sofa beds. One of these was on the screened porch so it was a plus. Everything was very clean and fresh linens were available all day. I had a chance to talk with the owner, Chieko, and found her to be one of the hardest working people I have ever met. She is truly dedicated to making her guests feel welcome and comfortable. We rented one of her pontoon boats and had a great time. It was the way to see and appreciate the beauty of the lake. I would highly recommend a boat rental if you stay there. The rates were very reasonable. The pool area was a huge hit with our kids. They have a good sized waterslide and some very comfortable pool side loungers. They also have a great play area for the young ones that includes an old boat that has been made to be a part of the kids play area. Who needs slides when they can play in an actual boat and pretend to drive? All of the staff was very professional, yet holding onto that lakeside demeanour. I would have loved to utilize the hottub that overlooks the dock but the weather was too dang hot. If you are looking for a Hilton type hotel room, then this isn't for you. These cabins are the epitome of lakeside living complete with bugs, some outdated decor, and a great place to roast some marshmellows and make s'mores. It's why you come to the lake to relax. I would recommend this place to anyone, and my family will be coming back for sure. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families-our grandkids loved it”
Reviews.Author: cpjohannes
Reviews.Content: We were here on an extended family camp with our grandkids for three days. The owner was very helpful and accommodating. The facilities were excellent for our purposes. We especially liked the arrangement with the playground and pool near and in sight of our cabins. The kids loved rock hunting on the lake shore and playing in the pool. We also used the Resort's boat and tube for fun on the lake. The entrance road and interior roads were a little rough but the staff and pool soon had us forgetting about that. The beds seemed worn but slept well for me.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great for any size family or group.”
Reviews.Author: lke3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Green Valley Resort for a Thanksgiving family reunion. We had searched several places in different locations but this was the best priced and the owner was very accommodating. She had even offered to reserve tickets we needed for shows. We reserved several different units. All the units were very clean, beds were comfortable, plenty of dishes, towels and cookware. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with our needs. We recommended this to our friends who come to Branson on weekends and will stay here again. It was very peaceful and view of the lake was great.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Greenvalley Resort & will stay again every year!”
Reviews.Author: boysgama
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Branson for 25 years & staying in cabins for 5 years & as my brother in law said, "This is the best place we have stayed". There is usually 10 of our family members traveling together & the Big House works GREAT!! You have so much room to spread out, you're not running into anyone & you can go out on the screened in porch for peace! My husband & I went by ourselves this trip, Greenvalley is the most relaxing place you will ever want to go. We love the fact that it is away from Branson, but you're only about 20 min away and it is so quiet & peaceful. The beds are really comfy, everything you will need to cook with is in the kitchen, cable TV and of course, the owner Chieko is there for all your questions & needs. She is a wonderful lady & will help you anyway she can. We have already made reservations for our Xmas vacation!! Don't miss out on this quaint & quiet piece of Heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful view, Clean accomadations”
Reviews.Author: skeexic
Reviews.Content: My Husband chose Green Valley for our Anniversary get away, Our Cabin faced the lake and what a view it was. If your taste is more glamourous this is not for you, but for us it was beutiful and clean! The Staff was pleasant and very accomodating to our Needs. The Pontoon Boat looked New,(there were 3 pontoon boats) Our host showed us how to run and operate the boat in detail. The cleanliness of the Kitchenette was a plus, bathroom towels abundant, good hot showers, t.v./cable a plus for husband (Game Time very Important). Thank you again, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: MWsogetthis
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Green Valley Resort was a pleasant one. The layout of the resort made it easy to walk to the office, pools, and playground, even with young kids. The resort is situated right on the lake, although its at the top of a pretty steep hill. (If you need to carry items onto the boat docks plan to bring a vehicle and park). The location of the resort is several miles from any busy retail and traffic areas so it has a remote feel to it. The cabins are very close to each other but still allow for some privacy. The cabins themselves were a bit dated, but clean and relatively spacious with basics like kitchen utensils provided. We rented a pontoon on our visit and had a great time on the lake. The boats are newer and well maintained. Chieko, the owner was very friendly and willing to answer the questions we had. She and the staff made themselves available pretty much anytime night or day. If you're looking for a hotel vacation this isn't your place, but if you're looking for a great no-frills weekend getaway with a family this is a great choice. We're thinking about booking a family reunion for next year.

Reviews.Title: “No cabins for you! NEXT!”
Reviews.Author: elonhaul
Reviews.Content: Ever drive 10 hours to find out that your rooms have been sold to someone else? That happened with two of the twenty-one cabins our family reserved for our FAMILY REUNION this summer. We negotiated for over a year at GVR (via numerous emails and phone calls) to reserve a week when the "whole resort" or "entire resort" was available. .…because of a “deposit discrepancy” two families were ousted upon arrival. They found accommodations down the road (lucky there was availability during 4th of July!!). We were never informed of any “missing deposits”. Our intention to book the “entire resort” was clear to Chieko (owner) when we put a deposit down on an unreserved cabin, guaranteeing payment if a family was unable to attend. We also had problems with Rate discrepancies and were offered a boat rental discount for the day but only if it was rented for a week. All in all, the resort was laid out perfectly for a Family Reunion with a central area (pool, playground, horseshoes etc) surrounded by the cabins. Conducive to those with very young or older family members. A pavilion would be a great addition to accommodate for meal gatherings or rain. EXCLUSIVE?: Pool was great, although locals or friends of owners can use the pool/spa even if a FAMILY REUNION books the "whole resort" paying over $15,000 for the week.... hey, maybe they paid too? ACCOMMODATIONS: A few cabins are very updated, others were much older and in decent shape, but one had ceiling tiles falling in over the bed and the two-story 4 unit house was very slanted (no, it's not your sea legs). SERVICE: Ample supplies of towels and linens were available. Gerry, the handy man, was great to fix things that broke and worked at preventative maintenance also. Chieko, the owner, seems nice and has been in this business for many years so she knows exactly what the deal is. Shrewd transactions are recommended to avoid misinterpretation of terminology or language. The other clients, who were given our cabins at GVR during our reunion, told us that they come there every year during 4th of July week. Meaning the “entire resort” was never available…? Maybe next year. Unfortunately, a Family Reunion for 123 immediate family members doesn’t happen every year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: Texastraveler05
Reviews.Content: We had a nice and relaxing stay at the Green Valley Resort. The staff was courteous and helpful. There was plenty of activities to keep the kids busy and the accomodations were very clean and the grounds were well maintained. The views of the lake were beautiful and resort was close enough to Branson so that we were able to take advantage of the activities and shows there. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Jewls1802
Reviews.Content: My family visits Branson every Spring. This is the first year we stayed at Green Valley Resort and I promise it will not be the last!!! We traveled with our 1 year old son and 3 adults. The cabins were very quaint, accomodating, and clean. This is not a 5 star resort by any means and it is not meant to be that way. This resort is for people who want a clean, beautiful, quiet atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle of town. We had a delightful experience, the staff was absolutely wonderful and the service was even better!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: figgy33
Reviews.Content: We visited Green Valley Resort in June 2007 for 1 week. The lady that ran the place was absolutely sweet! She went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable. Once we got to the cabin we had noticed the grass was a little high, but assumed it would be taken care of during our stay--that didnt' happen. The cabin was a decent size, the bathroom didnt have a tub, so I had to bathe my toddle in the kitchen sink. The hot water heater was out and had to be worked--BUT "Jerry" was there within minutes to fix it. It was a propane heater, right above the sink, when the hot water was turned on, a very quick burst of blue flames would shoot out of the thing... weird. The only air conditioning was a window unit in the kitchen, which was fine except for at night- the bedrooms were pretty warm, we bought fans to keep us cool. The electricity wasn't working in the rooms, but again- "Jerry" was there to change a fuse. There weren't enough outlets to plug things into, we had to unplug to microwave to plug in the toaster, and when my kids wanted to watch a dvd (we brought our own player), we'd have to unplug the microwave (only 1 plug in the living area). The carpets left your feet black... We had to wear our sandals after we got out of the shower. The pool was nice and clean (when they say "solar" heated, they just mean warmed by the sun) which didn't see much sun, the pool is surrounded by trees, it was pretty chilly, but my kids enjoyed it. The playground need a lot of work. About 90% of the toys in the sand box, and around the playground were broken and had lots of sharp edges, several bull ants were seen as well... The laundry facility consisted of one washer and one dryer at $1.25 each. No real access to the lake unless you have or rent a boat. If it were'nt for the nice lady that made sure we were doing good- I would have given this place a really bad review. I did enjoy my self, the beds were very comfortable- being able to help myself to clean towels and bed linens are wonderful! Not too close to town, so it was quiet. And for the price at stay 4 nights, get the 5th free, it was a good stay for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Green Valley Resort for a week and totally enjoyed it. If you have five star tastes, this is not for you. If you want a clean and and relaxing place to stay, then I highly recommend it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil lakeside retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Green Valley several times each year over the past 3 years. We have been frequenting Table Rock Lake for some time and this is one of the cleanest lakeside resorts we found. It isn't a 5 star resort, but a tranquil lakeside retreat. The staff is always helpful and friendly. The grounds of resort is always well kept. I have never seen the pool dirty even after it has been used all day (The pool has a slide which the kids loved). There are many activities to keep you busy. We had a day we played horse shoes, volley ball and shuffle board with the kids most of the day. It is located right on the lake and has a swim/boat dock in a quiet cove that is perfect for swimming and fishing. It is very convienent for the boater. We have a boat and used one of their boat slips and it makes it easy to go in for supplies or lunch. We rented one of their boats a few years ago and it was spotless and very well kept (didn't look or run like a rental). They have a hot tub and a double swing that overlooks the lake that is very relaxing. Had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Green Valley Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 87 Greenvalley Lane, Branson West, Branson, MO 65737
